If bodhisattvas cultivate ten kinds of dharmas, they can avoid the eight difficulties.
What are the ten?

Eighth, being endowed with superior vows;
Ninth, giving rise to much revulsion;
Tenth, giving rise to diligent effort.
Good sons!

Because bodhisattvas do not create unwholesome karma, they do not fall into the hells. Even if they manifest being born in the hells, they do not experience the extreme suffering of the hells, nor do they remain in the hells for long. Moreover, they do not give rise to a mind of anger and resentment towards beings there.
Why is this?
It is because bodhisattvas, by their very nature, cultivate the ten wholesome deeds. For this reason, bodhisattvas do not fall into the hells.

Because bodhisattvas do not give rise to stinginess, and do not fall into the realm of hungry ghosts due to stingy causes and conditions, even if they manifest being born in that realm, they do not experience the suffering of hungry ghosts.
Moreover, good man!
Bodhisattvas are not born in families with wrong views. Even if born there, they do not destroy pure faith. Bodhisattvas always encounter good and virtuous friends.
Why is this?

Bodhisattvas have long cultivated wholesome dharmas and planted various roots of virtue under past buddhas. They are always born in families with right views. Having been born there, they are replete with pure faith and also greatly increase pure faith.
Moreover, good man!
Bodhisattvas' faculties are also not deficient or damaged. If their faculties are deficient or damaged, they cannot become vessels for the Dharma within the Buddha's teachings.

Therefore, bodhisattvas are born in the desire realm, where sentient beings encounter the appearance of a buddha, delight in intimacy, and can be liberated.
Why is this?
Because bodhisattvas are well-endowed with skillful means.

Bodhisattvas are not born in worlds without buddhas. If born there, they would not see buddhas, hear the Dharma, or make offerings to the Sangha. Therefore, bodhisattvas are born in buddha-lands endowed with the three jewels.
Why is this?
It is due to the perfection of the excellent vows cultivated in the past.
Moreover, good sons!
If bodhisattvas hear of things that should be detested, there is none that does not give rise to a mind of aversion.
Why is this?

As soon as bodhisattvas hear of these things, they give rise to a mind of disgust. Having given rise to disgust, they arouse diligent effort, cultivate wholesome dharmas, and cut off unwholesome dharmas.
Good sons!
If bodhisattvas cultivate these ten kinds of dharmas, they will be able to distance themselves from the eight difficulties.
Moreover, good sons!
If bodhisattvas cultivate ten kinds of dharmas, they will not forget the mind of enlightenment.
What are the ten?
First, being free from flattery and deception;
Second, being upright and without crookedness, pure and clean, free from pursuit, doubt, and discrimination;
Third, upholding the Buddha's teachings;
Fourth, not being stingy with the Dharma;
Fifth, being free from miserliness with the Dharma;
Sixth, not creating causes and conditions that obstruct the Dharma;
Seventh, having no false speech;
Eighth, embracing the Mahayana teachings and practicing as taught, giving rise to a respectful mind towards those who uphold the Mahayana;
Ninth, towards those who uphold the Mahayana, in order to gradually enter the Mahayana, giving rise to the thought of intimacy;
Tenth, in order to deeply enter the Mahayana, towards the Dharma teachers, giving rise to the thought of them as teachers.
Good sons!
If bodhisattvas cultivate these ten kinds of dharmas, they will attain the mind of enlightenment that is not forgotten.
Moreover, good man!
If bodhisattvas cultivate ten kinds of dharmas, they will attain the supernormal knowledge of past lives.
What are the ten?
First, making offerings to the buddhas;
Second, upholding the true Dharma;
Third, cultivating and upholding pure precepts;
Fourth, eliminating doubts and removing hindrances;
Fifth, giving rise to much joy;
Sixth, making many contemplations;
Seventh, always abiding in a concentrated mind;
Eighth, the place of birth is pure;
Ninth, always receiving a transformed birth;
Tenth, attaining a clear and sharp consciousness.
Good man!

Because bodhisattvas extensively make offerings to the Buddha, they are able to revere the true Dharma. Because they revere the Dharma, they are able to uphold and recite the scriptures in the presence of those who uphold the Dharma. They expound the Dharma they have attained to others in detail, and because of this, they do not begrudge their lives and diligently practice and uphold the true Dharma. They are also able to cultivate and uphold pure precepts.
There are three kinds of precepts, namely, those of body, speech, and mind.
Because the precepts of the three karmas are pure, one is able to eliminate doubts and remove all afflictive hindrances.
Why is this?
First, because of the purity of precepts and conduct, one is able to eliminate doubts and remove hindrances;
Because of the removal of doubts and hindrances, one gives rise to much joy. Because the mind is joyful, one often engages in contemplation;
Because of contemplation, one always abides in a concentrated mind. Because the mind abides in concentration, one is born in a pure place;
Because the place is pure, one always receives a transformed birth. Because of a transformed birth, one attains a clear and sharp consciousness;

Because their consciousness is clear and sharp, they can know one, two, three, four, or five lifetimes, or ten, twenty, up to countless hundreds of thousands of lifetimes, and the events of their past lives.
Good sons!
If bodhisattvas cultivate these ten kinds of dharmas, they will attain the supernormal knowledge of past lives.
Furthermore, good sons!
If bodhisattvas cultivate ten kinds of dharmas, they will not be apart from good and virtuous friends.

Second, they are not apart from hearing the Dharma;
Third, they are not apart from making offerings to the Sangha;
Fourth, they are not apart from praising, worshipping, joining palms in respect, or bowing their heads to the ground in reverence to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas;

If bodhisattvas cultivate these ten kinds of dharmas, they will not leave the good and virtuous friends.
Furthermore, good sons!
If bodhisattvas cultivate ten kinds of dharmas, they will be able to leave the evil and unvirtuous friends.
What are the ten?
First, because they leave the people who violate the precepts, they can leave the evil and unvirtuous friends;
second, they leave the people who violate the right views;
third, they leave the people who violate the rules and standards;
fourth, they leave the people who violate the right livelihood;
fifth, they leave the people who are addicted;
sixth, they leave the people who are lazy;

Ninth, they stay far away from people who are close to laypeople;
Tenth, they stay far away from all afflictions, and thus are able to stay away from bad friends.
Good man!

Although bodhisattvas stay far away from these kinds of places, they still do not give rise to a hateful mind, a mind of affliction, or a mind of contempt towards those people. Bodhisattvas only give rise to this mind:

'As the Buddha has said, all sentient beings' various realms are formed through the conditions of their natures and desires, and because of the habit of associating with each other, there is then destruction. Therefore, I now stay away from the nature of what I am used to.'

If bodhisattvas cultivate these ten kinds of dharmas, they will then be able to stay far away from bad friends.
Furthermore, good man!
